CDFglobalAttributes.Data_type: DP23>Data Product 2.3: MIGHTI Retrieved Temperatures and Brightnesses
CDFglobalAttributes.Description: ICON MIGHTI-B Level 2.3 Retrieved Temperature File
CDFglobalAttributes.Descriptor: MIGHTI-B>Michelson Interferometer for Global High resolution imaging of the Thermosphere and Ionosphere
CDFglobalAttributes.LINK_TEXT: All ICON information and data can be found at the
CDFglobalAttributes.Logical_source_description: ICON MIGHTI-B Level 2.3 Retrieved Temperature File
CDFglobalAttributes.TEXT: ICON explores the boundary between Earth and space - the ionosphere - to understand the physical connection between our world and the immediate space environment around us. Visit 'http://icon.ssl.berkeley.edu' for more details.
CDFglobalAttributes.Text_Supplement: MIGHTI samples the O2 A band spectral region at five different wavelengths in order to both measure the shape of the band and to specify a background radiance that is subtracted from the signal. The wavelengths of the filter passbands are selected to maximize the sensitivity to lower thermospheric temperature variations. Two filter channels sample either end of the band to define a background (754.1 nm and 780.1 nm) and three more sample its shape (760.0 nm, 762.8 nm and 765.2 nm). Using three filters that sample the band shape allows the simultaneous retrieval of the atmospheric temperature and common shifts in the center wavelengths of the pass bands due to thermal drifts of the filters [Stevens et al., 2018; Englert et al., 2017].MIGHTI has two identical sensor units: MIGHTI-A and MIGHTI-B. The operations are conducted such that MIGHTI-B measures the same volume of air as MIGHTI-A but approximately 8 minutes later.

VarAttributes.CATDESC: ms since 1970-01-01 00:00:00 UTC at middle of image integration
VarAttributes.NC_STRINGS_V: CatDesc Depend_0 FieldNam Format MonoTon LablAxis Long_Name Time_Base Time_Scale Units Var_Notes Var_Type
VarAttributes.VAR_NOTES: This variable contains the time corresponding to the temperature profiles reported in this file. The variable is in ms since 1970-01-01 00:00:00 UTC at middle of image integration. A human-readable version of the time can be found in the variable ICON_...UTC_Time.

VarAttributes.CATDESC: time_inboard
VarAttributes.VAR_NOTES: Computed CDF_Epoch value: time_base+Epoch added by SPDF

VarAttributes.CATDESC: time base
VarAttributes.VAR_NOTES: EPOCH of 01-Jan-1970 00:00:00 - added by SPDF

VarAttributes.CATDESC: Derived A-Band Temperatures
VarAttributes.NC_STRINGS_V: CatDesc Depend_0 Depend_1 Display_Type FieldNam Format LablAxis Long_Name Time_Base Time_Scale Units Var_Notes Var_Type
VarAttributes.VAR_NOTES: Derived temperatures from A band by altitude. Temperatures are retrieved from the rotational distribution of emission lines in the O2 A band.  The measurement is made at 5 spectral channels. 3 channels measure the A band and 2 others on either side of the band measure a background, which is subtracted from the 3 signal channels. An entire altitude profile is observed simultaneously. An onion-peeling inversion is used on the raw observations to remove the effects of the integration along the line of sight. See Stevens et al. (Space Science Reviews (2018) 214:4. https://doi.org/10.1007/s11214-017-0434-9). O2 A band spectra are  pre-calculated from 100-400 K in 20 K increments based on the HITRAN 2016 database [Gordon et al., JQSRT (2017), 203:3-69.https://doi.org/10.1016/j.jqsrt.06.038]  and smoothed filter functions with FWHM of ~2.0 nm. The filter functions are based on Gaussian fits to laboratory measurements and are a function of channel,  row (altitude), and column. The fits are separately done for each pixel as a function of peak wavenumber (wavelength), width, and transmittance. For each of the  three signal channels the fitted Gaussians are co-added over 51 pixels where the transmittance is largest for a representative filter function for that channel.  The transmittances are not absolutely calibrated in photometric units, but the relative transmittance between channels and between detectors is maintained,  which allows for the retrieval of temperature at the tangent altitude.

VarAttributes.CATDESC: Bias (systematic) uncertainties in derived temperatures by altitude.
VarAttributes.NC_STRINGS_V: CatDesc Depend_0 Depend_1 Display_Type FieldNam Format LablAxis Long_Name Time_Base Time_Scale Units Var_Notes Var_Type
VarAttributes.VAR_NOTES: Estimated bias uncertainties in derived temperatures by altitude; aka systematic uncertainties. These uncertainties are present in each temperature profile and are primarily due to 1) a 1 cm-1 uncertainty in the common shift applied to pre-flight laboratory determined filter positions. This uncertainty was tested in the retrieval and a derived fixed uncertainty of 12 K is propagated at all altitudes and 2) the lack of measurements above the top altitude sampled,  and altitude dependent, with the topmost altitudes of the retrieval affected the most.  The temperature bias uncertainty is found by a root sum square of these two.  At most altitudes the estimated bias uncertainty is dominated by the uncertainty in the common shift.  The systematic bias is the same at all altitudes for daytime images or nighttime images.  However, the bias can be different for daytime images and nighttime images.

VarAttributes.CATDESC: Statistical (1-sigma) uncertainties in derived temperature by altitude.
VarAttributes.NC_STRINGS_V: CatDesc Depend_0 Depend_1 Display_Type FieldNam Format LablAxis Long_Name Time_Base Time_Scale Units Var_Notes Var_Type
VarAttributes.VAR_NOTES: Statistical uncertainties (one sigma) in derived temperatures by altitude

VarAttributes.CATDESC: Total uncertainties in derived temperatures by altitude
VarAttributes.NC_STRINGS_V: CatDesc Depend_0 Depend_1 Display_Type FieldNam Format LablAxis Long_Name Time_Base Time_Scale Units Var_Notes Var_Type
VarAttributes.VAR_NOTES: Total uncertainties in derived temperatures by altitude: Here the statistical temperature uncertainty has been linearly added to the estimated temperature bias.

VarAttributes.CATDESC: Quality Flag indicating an inappropriate calibration file has been used or was missing
VarAttributes.NC_STRINGS_V: CatDesc Depend_0 Display_Type FieldNam Format LablAxis Long_Name Time_Base Time_Scale Units Var_Notes Var_Type
VarAttributes.VAR_NOTES: Quality Flag indicating an inappropriate calibration file has been used or was missing

VarAttributes.CATDESC: Quality Flag indicating that the spacecraft is within the South Atlantic Anomaly
VarAttributes.NC_STRINGS_V: CatDesc Depend_0 Display_Type FieldNam Format LablAxis Long_Name Time_Base Time_Scale Units Var_Notes Var_Type
VarAttributes.VAR_NOTES: Quality Flag indicating that the spacecraft is within the South Atlantic Anomaly (0 = not in SAA)

VarAttributes.CATDESC: Derived scaling of O2 A Band to Radiances by altitude.
VarAttributes.NC_STRINGS_V: CatDesc Depend_0 Depend_1 Display_Type FieldNam Format LablAxis Long_Name Time_Base Time_Scale Units Var_Notes Var_Type
VarAttributes.VAR_NOTES: Derived common scaling of O2 A Band radiances in the 3 signal channels by altitude. Calculated forward radiances are fit to the observations from each of the  three signal channels. The scaling is done at each tangent altitude separately and interatively until a best fit solution is found. The intensity of each signal channel relative  to the other two determines the temperature, so the scale factor is unitless. The scaling is derived using pre-calculated spectra from the HITRAN 2016 database  [Gordon et al., JQSRT, 203, 3-69  (2017)].

VarAttributes.CATDESC: Uncertainty in Scaling of O2 A Band to Radiances by altitude.
VarAttributes.FIELDNAM: Uncertainty (1-sigma) in A Band Intensity Scaled
VarAttributes.LABLAXIS: Uncertainty in A Band Intensity Scaled
VarAttributes.NC_STRINGS_V: CatDesc Depend_0 Depend_1 Display_Type FieldNam Format LablAxis Long_Name Time_Base Time_Scale Units Var_Notes Var_Type
VarAttributes.VAR_NOTES: Derived uncertainty (1-sigma) in derived common scaling of O2 A Band to emergent intensity by altitude.
VarAttributes.x_LABLAXIS: Uncertainty in A Band Intensity Scaled

VarAttributes.CATDESC: Background Signal by filter by altitude and filter. This has been corrected for flatfield effects across the detector.
VarAttributes.NC_STRINGS_V: CatDesc Depend_0 Depend_1 Depend_2 Display_Type FieldNam Format LablAxis Long_Name Time_Base Time_Scale Units Var_Notes Var_Type
VarAttributes.VAR_NOTES: Background Signal by altitude and filter. This background is interpolated across the 3 signal channels from two background channels located spectrally on either side of the O2 A band.

VarAttributes.CATDESC: ---> Movie of above
VarAttributes.NC_STRINGS_V: CatDesc Depend_0 Depend_1 Depend_2 Display_Type FieldNam Format LablAxis Long_Name Time_Base Time_Scale Units Var_Notes Var_Type
VarAttributes.VAR_NOTES: Background Signal by altitude and filter. This background is interpolated across the 3 signal channels from two background channels located spectrally on either side of the O2 A band.

VarAttributes.CATDESC: Derived Slope of Subtracted Background.
VarAttributes.NC_STRINGS_V: CatDesc Depend_0 Depend_1 Display_Type FieldNam Format LablAxis Long_Name Time_Base Time_Scale Units Var_Notes Var_Type
VarAttributes.VAR_NOTES: Derived slope of subtracted background. The slope of the background is saved here for diagnostic purposes. It is calculated by taking  the difference of the flatfielded signal from the two background channels and dividing by the difference of the the channel center wavelengths (in nm)  of the two background channels (approximately 780 nm - 754 nm). This is done explicitly by [bg2 - bg1]/flatfield/[wavelength2 - wavelength1],  where bg2 and bg1 are the observed background signals in electrons.

VarAttributes.CATDESC: Total boresight to sun angle
VarAttributes.NC_STRINGS_V: CatDesc Depend_0 Display_Type FieldNam Format LablAxis Long_Name Time_Base Time_Scale Units Var_Notes Var_Type
VarAttributes.VAR_NOTES: Total boresight to sun angle

VarAttributes.CATDESC: Field of view azimuth angle
VarAttributes.NC_STRINGS_V: CatDesc Depend_0 Depend_1 Display_Type FieldNam Format LablAxis Long_Name Time_Base Time_Scale Units Var_Notes Var_Type
VarAttributes.VAR_NOTES: Field of view azimuth angle

VarAttributes.CATDESC: Filter Center Wavelength
VarAttributes.NC_STRINGS_V: CatDesc Depend_0 Depend_2 Depend_1 Display_Type FieldNam Format LablAxis Long_Name Time_Base Time_Scale Units Var_Notes Var_Type
VarAttributes.VAR_NOTES: Filter Center Wavelength used in temperature retrieval (=1e7/FilterCWN).

VarAttributes.CATDESC: Filter Center Wavenumber
VarAttributes.NC_STRINGS_V: CatDesc Depend_0 Depend_2 Depend_1 Display_Type FieldNam Format LablAxis Long_Name Time_Base Time_Scale Units Var_Notes Var_Type
VarAttributes.VAR_NOTES: Filter Center Wavenumber used in temperature retrieval as measured in the laboratory and fitted by a Gaussian. These filter center wavenumbers vary with detector (MIGHTI A and MIGHTI B), with altitude as well as with channel. They are also  difference for daytime and nighttime operations. It is from these center wavenumbers that the common wavenumber shift (across all channels) is calculated.

VarAttributes.CATDESC: Wavelength labels corresponding to the five filters
VarAttributes.NC_STRINGS_V: CatDesc FieldNam Long_Name Var_Notes Var_Type
VarAttributes.VAR_NOTES: Wavelength labels corresponding to the five filters. These are for guidance. Actual values used in retrieval for  MIGHTI-A and MIGHTI-B (day/night) are in ICON_L23_MIGHTI_(A or B)_Filter_Center_Wavelength.

VarAttributes.CATDESC: Common shift of all filter center wavenumbers due to temperature by altitude
VarAttributes.NC_STRINGS_V: CatDesc Depend_0 Depend_1 Display_Type FieldNam Format LablAxis Long_Name Time_Base Time_Scale Units Var_Notes Var_Type
VarAttributes.VAR_NOTES: Common shift of all filter center wavenumbers due to thermal drift that is added to laboratory measured filter center wavenumbers. The three channels measuring the A band overdetermines the temperature such that the wavenumber registration due to any thermal drift of the instrument can be additionally inferred. This is typically fixed with altitude and determined (along with temperature) from the signal originating from the O2 A band as measured from 3 signal channels.

VarAttributes.CATDESC: Uncertainty (1-sigma) in the shift of all filter center wavenumbers by altitude.
VarAttributes.NC_STRINGS_V: CatDesc Depend_0 Depend_1 Display_Type FieldNam Format LablAxis Long_Name Time_Base Time_Scale Units Var_Notes Var_Type
VarAttributes.VAR_NOTES: Uncertainties (1-sigma) in the shift of all filter center wavenumbers. If the common wavenumber shift is fixed with altitude and prescribed, then this uncertainty is zero everywhere.

VarAttributes.CATDESC: ms since 1980-01-06 00:00:00 TAI (coincident with UTC) at middle of image integration.
VarAttributes.NC_STRINGS_V: CatDesc Depend_0 Display_Type FieldNam Format LablAxis Long_Name Time_Base Time_Scale Units Var_Notes Var_Type
VarAttributes.VAR_NOTES: ms since 1980-01-06 00:00:00 TAI (coincident with UTC) at middle of image integration. Derived from original GPS values  reported from spacecraft (Time_GPS_Seconds and Time_GPS_Subseconds). Time calculation is offset by 615ms (flush time)  for the first image in the series and for all other images are adjusted by subtracting (integration time + 308 ms)  from the reported GPS time.

VarAttributes.CATDESC: 20MHz clock (50 nanosecond) offset from GPS seconds.
VarAttributes.NC_STRINGS_V: CatDesc Depend_0 Display_Type FieldNam Format LablAxis ScaleTyp Units Var_Notes Var_Type
VarAttributes.VAR_NOTES: GPS Time in sub seconds, 50 nanosecond offset from GPS seconds from 20 MHz clock.

VarAttributes.CATDESC: Time to integrate MIGHTI-B region of interest (ROI) image.
VarAttributes.NC_STRINGS_V: CatDesc Depend_0 Display_Type FieldNam Format LablAxis Long_Name ScaleTyp Units Var_Notes Var_Type
VarAttributes.VAR_NOTES: MIGHTI Integration Time in millieconds

VarAttributes.CATDESC: Relative radiance by filter by altitude
VarAttributes.NC_STRINGS_V: CatDesc Depend_0 Depend_1 Depend_2 Display_Type FieldNam Format LablAxis Long_Name Time_Base Time_Scale Units Var_Notes Var_Type
VarAttributes.VAR_NOTES: Observed relative radiance by filter and altitude. The retrieval is based on a forward modeling approach to these observed radiances as  reported in electrons/s from the MIGHTI L1 product. These are converted to electrons based on the integration time during day (30 s) or night (60 s).

VarAttributes.CATDESC: ---> movie of above
VarAttributes.NC_STRINGS_V: CatDesc Depend_0 Depend_1 Depend_2 Display_Type FieldNam Format LablAxis Long_Name Time_Base Time_Scale Units Var_Notes Var_Type
VarAttributes.VAR_NOTES: Observed relative radiance by filter and altitude. The retrieval is based on a forward modeling approach to these observed radiances as  reported in electrons/s from the MIGHTI L1 product. These are converted to electrons based on the integration time during day (30 s) or night (60 s).

VarAttributes.CATDESC: Uncertainty in relative radiance by filter and altitude.
VarAttributes.FIELDNAM: Uncertainty in Rel Radiance per filter
VarAttributes.NC_STRINGS_V: CatDesc Depend_0 Depend_1 Depend_2 Display_Type FieldNam Format LablAxis Long_Name Time_Base Time_Scale Units Var_Notes Var_Type
VarAttributes.VAR_NOTES: Uncertainty (1-sigma) in relative radiance by filter by altitude and filter. These are calculated by taking the square root of the total number  of electrons in each of the three signal channels, which are 51 pixels wide for MIGHTI-A or MIGHTI-B (day or night).

VarAttributes.CATDESC: ---> movie of above
VarAttributes.FIELDNAM: Uncertainty in Rel Radiance per filter
VarAttributes.NC_STRINGS_V: CatDesc Depend_0 Depend_1 Depend_2 Display_Type FieldNam Format LablAxis Long_Name Time_Base Time_Scale Units Var_Notes Var_Type
VarAttributes.VAR_NOTES: Uncertainty (1-sigma) in relative radiance by filter by altitude and filter. These are calculated by taking the square root of the total number  of electrons in each of the three signal channels, which are 51 pixels wide for MIGHTI-A or MIGHTI-B (day or night).

VarAttributes.CATDESC: Tangent point altitude
VarAttributes.NC_STRINGS_V: CatDesc Depend_0 Depend_1 Display_Type FieldNam Format LablAxis Long_Name Time_Base Time_Scale Units Var_Notes Var_Type
VarAttributes.VAR_NOTES: Tangent point altitudes. These altitudes are the tangent altitude of the line of sight of each pixel.

VarAttributes.CATDESC: Tangent point latitudes by altitude
VarAttributes.NC_STRINGS_V: CatDesc Depend_0 Depend_1 Display_Type FieldNam Format LablAxis Long_Name Time_Base Time_Scale Units Var_Notes Var_Type
VarAttributes.VAR_NOTES: Tangent point latitudes by altitude. Note that these are a function of both epoch and altitude. Note also that due to the nature of the limb observations these latitudes are typically an average over many hundreds of kilometers.

VarAttributes.CATDESC: Local solar time at tangent point
VarAttributes.NC_STRINGS_V: CatDesc Depend_0 Depend_1 Display_Type FieldNam Format LablAxis Long_Name Time_Base Time_Scale Units Var_Notes Var_Type
VarAttributes.VAR_NOTES: Local solar time (0-24 h) at tangent point calculated using the equation of time. LST is a function of both epoch and altitude.

VarAttributes.CATDESC: Tangent point longitudes by altitude
VarAttributes.NC_STRINGS_V: CatDesc Depend_0 Depend_1 Display_Type FieldNam Format LablAxis Long_Name Time_Base Time_Scale Units Var_Notes Var_Type
VarAttributes.VAR_NOTES: Tangent point longitudes (0-360) by altitude. Note that these are a function of both epoch and altitude. Note also that due to the nature of the limb observations these longitudes are typically an average over many hundreds of kilometers.

VarAttributes.CATDESC: Tangent point magnetic latitudes by altitude.
VarAttributes.NC_STRINGS_V: CatDesc Depend_0 Depend_1 Display_Type FieldNam Format LablAxis Long_Name Time_Base Time_Scale Units Var_Notes Var_Type
VarAttributes.VAR_NOTES: Tangent point magnetic latitudes by altitude. Quasi-dipole latitude and longitude are calculated using the fast implementation developed by Emmert et al. (2010, doi:10.1029/2010JA015326) and the Python wrapper apexpy (doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.1214207). Quasi-dipole longitude is defined such that zero occurs where the geodetic longitude is near 285 deg east (depending on latitude). Note that these are a function of both epoch and altitude. Note also that due to the nature of the limb observations these latitudes are typically an average over many hundreds of kilometers.

VarAttributes.CATDESC: Tangent point magnetic longitudes (0-360) by altitude.
VarAttributes.NC_STRINGS_V: CatDesc Depend_0 Depend_1 Display_Type FieldNam Format LablAxis Long_Name Time_Base Time_Scale Units Var_Notes Var_Type
VarAttributes.VAR_NOTES: Tangent point magnetic longitudes by altitude. Quasi-dipole latitude and longitude are calculated using the fast implementation developed by Emmert et al. (2010, doi:10.1029/2010JA015326) and the Python wrapper apexpy (doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.1214207). Quasi-dipole longitude is defined such that zero occurs where the geodetic longitude is near 285 deg east (depending on latitude). Note that these are a function of both epoch and altitude. Note also that due to the nature of the limb observations these longitudes are typically an average over many hundreds of kilometers.

VarAttributes.CATDESC: Solar zenith angle at tangent point
VarAttributes.NC_STRINGS_V: CatDesc Depend_0 Depend_1 Display_Type FieldNam Format LablAxis Long_Name Time_Base Time_Scale Units Var_Notes Var_Type
VarAttributes.VAR_NOTES: Solar zenith angle at tangent point. SZA is a function of both epoch and altitude.

VarAttributes.CATDESC: Cold-side temperature of the thermoelectric cooler attached to the camera head
VarAttributes.NC_STRINGS_V: CatDesc Depend_0 Display_Type FieldNam Format LablAxis Long_Name Time_Base Time_Scale Units Var_Notes Var_Type
VarAttributes.VAR_NOTES: Cold-side temperature of the thermoelectric cooler attached to the camera head

VarAttributes.NC_STRINGS_V: CatDesc Depend_0 Display_Type FieldNam Format LablAxis Long_Name Time_Base Time_Scale Units Var_Notes Var_Type
